text.content:
Exhausted

  • Exhaustion comes in levels, with each level keeping the detriments of the previous level.
  • A long rest with food and drink reduces a creature’s exhaustion by 1 level.
  • Consequently, skipping a long rest can cause exhaustion to worsen.
  • When a creature’s exhaustion level decreases to 0, the condition is removed.
  • Level 1: Disadvantage on Skill Checks
  • Level 2: Speed halved
  • Level 3: Disadvantage on attack rolls and save checks
  • Level 4: Hit point maximum halved
  • Level 5: Speed reduced to 0
  • Level 6: Incapacitated
  • Level 7: Death
